photo-caption:
todaysdocument:

“FOR THE FORMER NAVAL PERSON
LONDON

The Senate passed the all-out declaration of war eighty-two to nothing, and the House has passed it three hundred eighty-eight to one. Today all of us are in the same boat with you and the people of the Empire and it is a ship which will not and cannot be sunk.

F. D. R.â

usnatarchivesexhibits:

Franklin D. Roosevelt to Winston Churchill.

Item From: Papers as President, Map Room File. (1933- 1945)

President Roosevelt wrote this letter for âThe Former Naval Personâ of London (Winston Churchill) to inform him that Congress had finally passed the Declaration of War. F.D.R. could not address Churchill directly due to the U.S.âs strong isolationist stance, and its previous fear of being drawn into another global conflict. He chose to refer to Churchill as a âFormer Naval Personâ because he first corresponded with Churchill when he was still First Lord of the Admiralty.
